One day after Google's surprise announcement that Larry Page would replace Eric Schmidt as chief executive officer, investors and industry insiders are grappling with how the change will affect the world's No. 1 Internet search company. What's going to change under Larry Page ? said BGC Partners analyst Colin Gillis, asking the question on the minds of executives from Silicon Valley to New York City.`` In our opinion, Larry Page is likely to increase investments as a priority.

considered too unseasoned to steer Google's operations, and comes as the company tries to maintain its dominance online in the face of growing rivals such as Facebook. He takes over for Eric Schmidt , 55. I am enormously proud of my last decade as CEO, and I am certain that the next 10 years under Larry will be even better! wrote Eric Schmidt in a post on Google's official blog.`` Larry, in my clear opinion, is ready to lead.''
